description: Borrowed from Hindi ठगी / Urdu ٿهگی‎ (ṭhagī).

entries.meaning: (historical, countable) A thug (member of band of assassins in India).
(historical, uncountable) The murder and robbery of groups of travellers in India.
examples: ‘In India, where everything began, this kind of human activity, obscene in itself, was undertaken on behalf of a goddess, called, I think, Kali; the murder was an act of so-called thugee, I was told.’
